Hi.

It's an aspect of how Java JMX-RMI works. Basically, the JMX port is o=
nly used to negotiate a connection to RMI-exported objects. By default the =
RMI port is dynamically allocated.

You can work around this, if you do a l=
ilttle extra work. Take a look at the following reference, that should show=
 you the way:

http://blogs.sun.com/jmxetc/entry/connecting_through_firewal=
l_using_jmx

Hope this helps,

Best,
  K=E5re
  netarchive.dk
--

all (just via iptables) on my remote box

rt 8849 (for JMX) on the remote

cal web GUI, the connection

tp I've seen that Heritrix opens 3 ports: 8849

 change everytime I launch Heritrix. If I
> open one of these two ports (in=
 addition to 8849), then I can connect
> correctly...
>

:
